channel.title: Coursera | Machine Learning Specialisation on Youniverse
channel.description: Recent content in Coursera | Machine Learning Specialisation on Youniverse

item.title: Coursera | Machine Learning Specialisation (0/n)
item.description: Recently, I’ve been thinking of picking up machine learning as it may be interesting to work on some toy projects. I started working on the Machine Learning Specialisation on Coursera. To me, Prof. Andrew Ng’s Machine Learning course on Coursera is one of the go-to material to get started with Machine Learning. This is my second time learning this course on Coursera, and the first time I did it, it was not yet a specialisation.

item.title: Coursera | Machine Learning Specialisation (2/n) - Supervised Learning
item.description: Supervised Learning Definitions and Notations Lowercase $x$: the standard notation to denote input, or input variable, or feature; Lowercase $y$: the standard notation to denote output, or target variable; Training set: the dataset that is used to train a model, i.e., all training examples; $m$: the total number of training examples; $(x, y)$: a single training example; $(x^{(i)}, y^{(i)})$: a specific training example, corresponds to a specific row in a table.

item.title: Coursera | Machine Learning Specialisation (1/n)
item.description: The current version is a specialisation consisting three courses: Supervised Machine Learning: Regression and Classification; Advanced Learning Algorithms; Unsupervised Learning, Recommenders, Reinforcement Learning. This article is a brief summary of Machine Learning taken from the specialisation. The first course in the specialisation, “Supervised Machine Learning: Regression and Classification”, provides a brief summary of the machine learning domain and goes introduces the details of supervised machine learning. Machine Learning ℹ️ Machine learning (ML) is the science of getting computers to learn without being explicitly programmed.
